seo.description: Tools for optimizing your website's search engine visibility

advanced.keywords-description: While less important for SEO today, some search engines still use keywords in their search algorithms. Use this field to include relevant keywords for your page.

tooltips.canonical-url-description: Specifies the preferred version of a page when similar content exists at multiple URLs. Helps prevent duplicate content issues.
tooltips.keywords-description: While less important for SEO today, some search engines still use keywords in their search algorithms. Use this field to include relevant keywords for your page.
tooltips.robots-description: Controls how search engines crawl and index your page. "Index, Follow" allows both indexing and following links.

basic.meta-description-description: A brief summary of your page content. This appears in search results below the title.
basic.title-tag-description: The title tag is crucial for SEO. It appears in search results and browser tabs.

meta-tags.description: Generate meta tags for your website

tooltips.card-type-description: Determines how your content appears when shared on Twitter. Summary cards include a small image, while Summary Large Image cards feature a prominent image.
tooltips.og-description-description: A brief description of the content, usually between 2 and 4 sentences. This will be displayed below the title.
tooltips.og-image-description: The URL for your page's preview image.
tooltips.og-title-description: The title of your article without any branding such as your site name. Keep it brief and engaging
tooltips.og-type-description: The type of your content. This impacts how your content shows up in Facebook Feed. Default is "website".
tooltips.og-url-description: The canonical URL for your page. This should be the undecorated URL without session variables or parameters.
tooltips.sample-fb: A sample result of how your content appears when shared on Facebook:
tooltips.twitter-card-description: A sample result of how your content appears when shared on X (Twitter):

meta-tags.title: Meta Tags Generator
meta-tags.your-page-description-placeholder: Your page description will appear here. Make it compelling to increase click-through rates.

basic.title: Basic SEO Settings
basic.description: Configure essential meta tags for search engine optimization.

settings.title: Basic Settings
settings.title_tag: Title Tag - The main title of your page that appears in search results
settings.meta_description: Meta Description - A brief summary of your page content
settings.keywords: Keywords - Relevant terms for search engines
settings.canonical_url: Canonical URL - The preferred version of your page

social.title: Social Media Settings
social.description: Customize how your content appears when shared on social media platforms.

settings.title: Social Media Tags
settings.og_title: Open Graph Title - Title for social media sharing
settings.og_description: Open Graph Description - Description for social media
settings.og_image: Open Graph Image - Preview image for social sharing
settings.twitter_card: Twitter Card - Control how content appears on Twitter

advanced.title: Advanced Options
advanced.description: Fine-tune additional meta tags for better control over your page's behavior.

settings.title: Advanced Settings
settings.robots: Robots Directives - Control search engine behavior
settings.additional_tags: Additional Meta Tags - Custom meta tags as needed

list.title: Available Features
list.live_preview: Live preview of search results appearance

tips.title: Tips & Best Practices

list.title: Usage Tips
list.unique_titles: Create unique, descriptive titles for each page
list.descriptive_meta: Write compelling meta descriptions that encourage clicks

tips.note: Note: Keep your meta tags concise, relevant, and optimized for both search engines and social media platforms. Regular testing and updating is recommended for best results.

og-image.description: Create perfect Open Graph images for social media sharing. Supports batch processing with custom dimensions and cropping.

all.title: Download All
all.tooltip: Download all images as a ZIP file

edit.description: Crop and adjust your image to the perfect Open Graph dimensions
edit.title: Edit

editor.title: Edit Image
editor.zoom-description: Adjust zoom level to fine-tune your image composition

input.description: Customize your Open Graph image with various settings to create the perfect social media preview.

dimensions.description: The generated image will be 1200x630 pixels, the recommended size for Open Graph images.
dimensions.title: Generated Image Dimensions

settings.description: Description text - Supporting text below the title
settings.font: Font family - Select from sans-serif, serif, or monospace fonts
settings.layout: Layout style - Different arrangements of title and description
settings.theme: Color theme - Choose between light, dark, or gradient themes
settings.title: Title text - The main heading of your image

input.title: Input Settings

output.description: Preview your image in real-time as you make changes, and download it when you're satisfied with the result.
output.title: Generated Image

list.contrast: Ensure good contrast between text and background
list.platforms: Consider how the image will appear on different platforms
list.preview-test: Test your image in social media preview tools
list.text-length: Keep titles concise and descriptions brief for better readability
list.title: Usage Tips

tips.note: Note: The generator creates optimized images for social media sharing. Test your images across different platforms to ensure they display correctly.
tips.title: Tips & Best Practices

info.description: Open Graph images are used by social media platforms when your content is shared. The recommended size is 1200×630 pixels (1.91:1 aspect ratio).

og-image.title: OG Image Generator

upload.description: Drag & drop images here, or click to select files
upload.formats: Supports PNG, JPG, JPEG, and WebP formats
upload.title: Upload Images
